meanings.definition: To incline or bend in a particular direction.
meanings.sent1: The tree tipped slightly in the wind.
meanings.sent2: She tipped her head to the side to listen better.
meanings.sent3: The leaning tower of Pisa tipped so much, it almost fell over!
meanings.sent4: His decision tipped the balance in our favor.
meanings.sent5: The boat tipped dangerously as the storm hit.

meanings.definition: To cover the end of something with a small amount of material.
meanings.sent1: She tipped the cake with chocolate frosting.
meanings.sent2: He tipped the pen with a colorful cap.
meanings.sent3: The artist tipped the brush with just a hint of paint.
meanings.sent4: The mountains were tipped with snow in the winter.
meanings.sent5: The table was tipped with a delicate lace cloth.

meanings.definition: To give a small amount of money to someone for their service.
meanings.sent1: She tipped the waiter for his excellent service.
meanings.sent2: He always tips the barista at his favorite coffee shop.
meanings.sent3: The child tipped the babysitter with a handful of coins.
meanings.sent4: The generous customer tipped the delivery person more than usual.
meanings.sent5: They tipped the tour guide at the end of the trip.
